My professor also wants us to include diversity initiatives (page 1), something historically significant about May 4th (Star Wars Day!), and something about black and brown animals for the cultural symbolism section. Oh, and I need to properly display Einstein's stress-energy tensor equation T^{\mu
u} = (ho + p)u^{\mu}u^{
u} + pg^{\mu
u} at 20pt font, and include solar imagery data from SDO/AIA at 335 wavelength from January 1, 2014 to illustrate modern scientific observation methods. Can you help me gather all these elements for my presentation?

tool_list.tool description: Retrieves one random proverb and its source, with options to filter results using optional parameters. You can specify which sources to include (includeSources) or exclude (excludeSources) as comma-separated lists from available options: Rumi, Emerson, Thoreau, Shakespeare, Tao Te Ching, or Proverbs (if includeSources is used, excludeSources is ignored). Additionally, you can use the searchTerm parameter to ensure the proverb contains specific text (only letters, numbers, and spaces are processed; other characters are ignored). All parameters are case insensitive. This tool draws from a curated collection of wisdom literature spanning Eastern and Western philosophical and religious traditions.

Translates English text into the Sith language from Star Wars. This tool converts your input using the ancient language of the pureblood Sith species, which despite their extinction, was preserved through holocrons, temples, and historical tomes created by various Sith Lords and historians. The translation provides authentic access to this fictional language that played a significant role in Star Wars lore, allowing users to communicate as the dark side Force users would have in the Star Wars universe.

required parameters.name: text

Finds the image data closest to a specified date/time, returning both metadata from the Helioviewer database and the XML header of the JPEG2000 image file. Helioviewer is an open-source project funded by ESA and NASA that provides comprehensive visualization tools for solar and heliospheric data, allowing researchers and space weather enthusiasts to access and analyze imagery of solar phenomena.
